revision.comment: removed [[Category:1997 disestablishments in the United Kingdom]]; added [[Category:1997 disestablishments in England]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox Military Unit |unit_name = RAF Staff College, Bracknell |image = [[File:Staff College Bracknell.jpg]] |caption = College crest |start_date = 1945 |end_date = 1997 |country = {{flagicon|UK}} [[United Kingdom]] |allegiance = |branch = [[File:Ensign of the Royal Air Force.svg|23px]] [[Royal Air Force]] |type = [[College]] |role = Air Staff Training |size = |command_structure = |garrison = Ramslade House, [[Bracknell]] |garrison_label = |equipment = |equipment_label = |nickname = |patron = |motto =''Visu et Nisu'' (''by vision and effort'') |colors = |colors_label = |march = |mascot = |battles = |anniversaries = |decorations = |battle_honours = <!-- Commanders --> |current_commander = |current_commander_label = |ceremonial_chief = |ceremonial_chief_label = |colonel_of_the_regiment = |colonel_of_the_regiment_label = |notable_commanders = <!-- Insignia --> |identification_symbol = |identification_symbol_label = |identification_symbol_2 = |identification_symbol_2_label = <!-- Aircraft --> |aircraft_attack = |aircraft_bomber = |aircraft_electronic = |aircraft_fighter = |aircraft_interceptor = |aircraft_recon = |aircraft_patrol = |aircraft_trainer = |aircraft_transport = }} The '''RAF Staff College''' at [[Bracknell]] was a [[Royal Air Force]] [[staff college]] active for most of the second half of the 20th century. Its role was the training of [[staff officer]]s in the administrative, staff and policy aspects of air force matters. Its motto was ''Visu et Nisu'' which is Latin for ''by vision and effort''. The equivalent in the [[British Army]] was the [[Staff College, Camberley]] and the equivalent in the [[Royal Navy]] was the [[Royal Naval College, Greenwich|Royal Naval Staff College, Greenwich]].
==History== [[File:Ramslade House, Bracknell.jpg|thumb|left|Ramslade House, Bracknell, formerly the RAF Staff College, Bracknell]] Ramslade House was built as suburban-style villa in 1840 and then substantially re-modelled by Lieutenant Colonel Frederick Mackenzie in 1895.<ref name=assess>{{cite web|url=http://www.theparksra.org.uk/v001/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/RamsladeReportNov2012.pdf|title=Building assessment for Ramslade House|publisher=Fred Aldsworth|accessdate=6 June 2015}}</ref> The house became the headquarters for [[RAF Second Tactical Air Force|Second Tactical Air Force]] in 1943 during the [[World War II|Second World War]].<ref name=assess/>
The Staff College at Bracknell was formed by transferring a major portion of the [[RAF Staff College, Bulstrode Park|Staff College at Bulstrode Park]] to Ramslade House in July 1945. [[Air Vice-Marshal]] [[Ronald Graham (RAF officer)|Ronald Graham]], the then Commandant at Bulstrode Park, became the first commandant at Bracknell.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.rafweb.org/Biographies/Graham_R.htm |title=Air Vice-Marshal R. Graham |first=M. B. |last=Barass |work=Air of Authority - A History of RAF Organisation |year=2015|accessdate=6 June 2015}}</ref>
On 1 May 1946 the Staff College was placed under the control of [[RAF Home Command|Reserve Command]]. Four years later, on 1 August 1950, that command was renamed [[RAF Home Command|Home Command]]. It was subsequently transferred to [[RAF Training Command|Training Command]] on 1 June 1968 and then transferred again to [[RAF Support Command]] on 13 June 1973. The final transfer came on 1 April 1994 when the Staff College was transferred to [[RAF Personnel and Training Command|Personnel and Training Command]] but this arrangement was short-lived as the College closed on 1 January 1997 when RAF staff training responsibilities were transferred to the newly established [[Joint Services Command and Staff College]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rafweb.org/Organsation/Estab1.htm |title=Other Establishments - Schools and Staff Colleges|publisher= Air of Authority - A History of RAF Organisation|accessdate=6 June 2015}}</ref> which was initially located on the same site at Bracknell but later moved to Shrivenham. [[Defence Infrastructure Organisation|Defence Estates]] disposed of the site in 2004, selling it to [[English Partnerships]], a regeneration agency.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20080804143951/http://www.englishpartnerships.co.uk/theparks.htm |title=The Parks, Bracknell|publisher=English Partnerships|accessdate=6 June 2015}}</ref>
==Commandants== Commandants include:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gulabin.com/armynavy/pdf/Royal%20Air%20Force%20Senior%20Appointments.pdf|title=Senior Royal Air Force appointments|accessdate=6 June 2015}}</ref> *July 1945 Air Vice-Marshal [[Ronald Graham (RAF officer)|R Graham]] *December 1945 Air Vice-Marshal [[Arthur Sanders (RAF officer)|A P M Sanders]] *1947 Air Vice-Marshal [[Thomas Williams (RAF officer)|T M Williams]] *1 January 1949 Air Vice-Marshal [[Donald Hardman|J D I Hardman]] *18 June 1951 Air Vice-Marshal [[Peter Gillmore|A D Gillmore]] *1953 Air Vice-Marshal [[Douglas Macfadyen|D Macfadyen]] *April 1956 Air Vice-Marshal [[Denis Barnett|D H F Barnett]] *1 August 1956 Air Vice-Marshal [[Roy Faville|R Faville]] *1 January 1957 Air Vice-Marshal [[Charles Elworthy, Baron Elworthy|S C Elworthy]] *1 December 1959 Air Vice-Marshal [[Maurice Heath|M L Heath]] *1 January 1962 Air Vice-Marshal [[David Lee (RAF officer)|D J P Lee]] *1 January 1965 Air Vice-Marshal [[Tim Piper (RAF officer)|T W Piper]] *1 June 1966 Air Vice-Marshal [[Deryck Stapleton|D C Stapleton]] *22 April 1968 Air Vice-Marshal [[Nigel Maynard|N M Maynard]] *27 September 1970 Air Vice-Marshal [[Michael Beetham|M J Beetham]] *2 October 1972 Air Vice-Marshal [[Alasdair Steedman|A McK S Steedman]] *16 August 1975 Air Vice-Marshal [[Keith Williamson|K A Williamson]] *23 February 1977 Air Vice-Marshal [[John Curtiss|J B Curtiss]] *27 February 1980 Air Vice-Marshal [[Michael Beavis|M Beavis]] *21 April 1981 Air Vice-Marshal [[David Parry-Evans|D G Parry-Evans]] *29 January 1983 Air Vice-Marshal [[Anthony Skingsley|A G Skingsley]] *29 September 1984 Air Vice-Marshal [[Alan White (RAF officer)|G A White]] *9 February 1987 Air Vice-Marshal [[Derek Bryant (RAF officer)|D T Bryant]] *6 January 1989 Air Vice-Marshal [[Sandy Hunter|A F C Hunter]] *8 August 1990 Air Vice-Marshal [[Robert Peters (RAF officer)|R G Peters]] *5 May 1993 Air Vice-Marshal [[Michael Donaldson (RAF officer)|M P Donaldson]] *15 January 1996 Air Vice-Marshal [[Marten van der Veen|M van Der Veen]]
